places.generalDescription: Sanctuary of Truth is a 20-story complex made entirely of hand-hewn wood carvings, still under construction but open for tours. Similar to the Tibetan sand mandala art, this massive teak structure is a blend of architecture and philosophy, depicting lessons from various religions emphasizing respect for elders, choosing company wisely, and treating others well. It serves as a remarkable place for reflection on higher ideals and the impermanence of life.

sources.snippet: Rising 105 meters into the sky and made from teak wood which has been carved in the most intricate wat The Sanctuary of Truth is a beautiful sight to behold. This is not a Buddhist temple as you may expect, it was designed by a business owner as a place to go and reflect on oneself. Every part of the building both inside and out has incredibly detailed carvings that need to be seen to be believed, the building itself is still a work in progress which some say will never be finished.

sources.snippet: The Sanctuary of Truth is an unfinished museum in Pattaya that is a hybrid of temple and castle, built on the theme of the Ayutthaya Kingdom and Hindu beliefs. This majestic place offers multiple photo spots such as the wooden castle itself located in the center, the surrounding beaches or the beautifully handcrafted sculptures in the castle. The best photographs that can be taken at this place is the full view of the castle and beach together.

sources.snippet: One of the few wooden historical architectures that still stands, the Sanctuary of Truth in Pattaya is a peaceful daytime activity to do away from the busy nightlife. It is the largest wooden construction in the world started in 1981. This castle does not attach itself to any religion, but it questions existence at its core with morals, and philosophies that are carved onto the castle walls.

sources.snippet: The Sanctuary of Truth, an enormous wooden structure by the sea, is an enthralling tribute to Thai architecture, culture, and spirituality. This magnificent temple is entirely made of wood and is intricately carved with mythological deities and themes from Hinduism and Buddhism. You'll be taken into a realm of old Thai artistry and philosophy as you traverse the complex.

The sanctuary of truth is conventionally divided into four zones, each of which symbolizes a certain culture: Thailand, China, India, Cambodia.

reviews.text:
The temple itself is absolutely stunning - one of the most beautiful I've seen in Asia. The craftsmanship and detail are truly impressive, and it feels very unique compared to other temples in the region.

However, the ticket price is insanely high, especially for Thailand. Also, you're required to join a guided tour to enter, which honestly wasn't great. Our guide seemed to just make things up or tell random stories that weren't very engaging. We ended up walking away from the group - which I highly recommend. Otherwise, you won't be able to take proper photos, since the group moves quickly and keeps you in one area.

Officially, after an hour with the guide, you're allowed to explore on your own and take pictures, but by then, you're already tired and not in the mood. So just quietly disconnect earlier if you want to enjoy it at your own pace.

Overall, the temple is incredible and definitely worth seeing once - just be prepared for the high price and the tour system.

The Sanctuary of Truth in Thailand is truly a wonder and an unforgettable experience. The entire museum is made of wood, and the intricate carvings are stunning. The place is not just beautiful but also deeply meaningful, with its philosophy and the Seven Truths of Life that can truly change how we see the world and make it a better place. The experience there was marvellous and very peaceful. It is also a fantastic spot for photography, with every corner offering something unique. I would highly recommend everyone to visit this place at least once in their life.

This is an overly impressive piece of architecture. First, you get to see wood workers constructing new additions to the building. You get an indepth explanation of everything you pass.

When you get to the building you will want to photograph every minute detail you, which is an impossible task. Every inch of the building is fascinating with a deep story attached to it. You could spend days here discovering everything.

Beyond the building they have food and other attractions. Boat rides, animal rides, massages, and photo ops. You will have a great time exploring and hanging out here. Give yourself many hours for a trip here.

places.generalDescription: Nong Nooch Botanical Garden is a sprawling 500-acre attraction that offers a diverse range of experiences. In addition to its themed gardens showcasing Thai culture, it features elephant shows and rides, as well as a variety of dining options. The garden is one of the largest botanical gardens in Southeast Asia and boasts an array of plant species, including orchids, bonsai trees, and cacti. Visitors can also enjoy performances, activities, and even explore a small zoo within the expansive grounds.

places.name: Nong Nooch Botanical Garden

reviews.text: It was a memorable experienceü§©. The garden is massive so you need to ride a shuttle bus to go around the garden. They will stop is every station for you to enjoy sightseeing and take pictures. Here you can interact with elephants too. Kids will enjoy the last stop coz it is full of dinosaurs üòÇ.

We visited Nong Nooch Botanical Garden and even though we arrived a bit late (around 5 PM, and it closes at 6 PM), we had an absolutely amazing time exploring the gardens.

Since we had about an hour, we decided to take the sightseeing bus, which was a perfect choice - it took us around the garden and allowed us to see so many of the beautiful areas quickly.
The views were stunning: endless colorful gardens, peaceful landscapes, and beautifully maintained areas everywhere we looked.

We also visited the dinosaur section and a beautiful temple area, which added a lot of excitement for the kids.
The dinosaur statues were huge and very realistic - the children had a lot of fun running around and exploring.
The temple was peaceful and beautifully designed, offering a nice cultural touch to the visit.

However, while we truly enjoyed the gardens themselves, we were very disappointed to learn about the elephant shows.
As many others have mentioned, the shows are cruel and unethical, and it's heartbreaking to see animals treated this way for entertainment.
Because of this, we chose not to pay for or watch the show and we would not recommend supporting it.
We believe that such practices do not belong in a place that celebrates the beauty of nature.

In summary:

The gardens are beautiful and worth seeing.

But we strongly encourage the management to stop the elephant shows and shift the focus entirely to the wonderful botanical experience they have built.

Until then, we cannot fully recommend a visit here unless it is solely to enjoy the gardens without supporting the animal shows.

A nice layout with lot of greenery. Divided into several zones. Animals, dinosaurs, pots piled up and structures made of them. Vibrant array of colors. Treat to the eyes. Hanging garden and lot more. Elephant rides also available here. Want to grab a quick snack visit Big C located within the premises. Don't forget to book their bus. Large area to cover.

places.generalDescription: Phra Tamnak Mountain Viewpoint, also known as Wat Phra Yai, is a temple situated on the lush Khao Phra Bat hill offering stunning views of Pattaya City and its shores. The iconic Golden Buddha statue sits atop the mountain, providing panoramic vistas of the bustling city and bay below. Visitors can enjoy the elaborate staircase leading to the temple and take in the breathtaking scenery from this elevated vantage point.

sources.snippet: Sitting at the top of a forested hill between South Pattaya and Jomtien is a giant Buddha statue known as Wat Phra Yai, The statue has its origins at a time when Pattaya was just a small fishing village, and a long way away from the world Pattaya finds itself in now. From the top of the hill you have panoramic views over Pattaya City and Bay.

places.generalDescription: Art In Paradise Pattaya is a captivating and interactive museum covering 5,800 square meters and featuring over a hundred 3D paintings. Visitors can immerse themselves in the art by posing with the vivid and realistic artworks, which include dioramas, dinosaurs, safari scenes, ocean-themed displays, and portraits of influential figures. The museum offers an engaging experience for both kids and adults, inviting them to take creative photos with the larger-than-life paintings.

sources.snippet: Art In Paradise Pattaya is among the largest 3D art museum in the world and the only one in Thailand. Here, you can find all kinds of visually-appealing 3D images, divided into 10 zones to enjoy. We recommend you bring someone to take photos of you since the majority of paintings are designed to have you pose  in front of them in order to see the images popping out.
sources.shortName: 10 Photo Spots & Places In Pattaya 2024

places.name: Art In Paradise Pattaya

reviews.text: A must visit place with kids. Many tour plans won't hav this in tour itinerary. As soon as we enter they ask us to remove foot wear. An app is downloaded. With that app - the 3D AI videos can be captured and saved. Very very vast area with huge collections

I visited Art in Paradise last week and it was an unexpectedly delightful experience. This 3D art museum is so much different to usual tourist attractions. This is a place to visit for creativity, illusion, and a bit of fun photography, this is a must-visit if you anyone mentioned above.

The museum is divided into themed zones, from ancient ruins and underwater worlds to fantasy landscapes and optical illusions. Each section is filled with meticulously painted artworks that come alive through clever 3D / AR . The key here is interaction: visitors are encouraged to pose, act, and become part of the art, which makes it especially engaging for families, couples, and even solo travelers.

Staff members are friendly and available to help with photo angles at the entrance. There are guides on the floor showing where to stand for the perfect shot, which is a helpful touch.

I appreciated how well-maintained the facility was. Cleanliness and lighting were top-notch, and crowd control was decent, even on a weekend afternoon. You'll easily spend  2 hours here, especially if you're aiming to capture fun memories.

Overall, Art in Paradise is more than a museum. Whether you're looking for a playful outing or Instagram-worthy photos, this spot delivers a unique blend of art and entertainment. Definitely worth the entrance fee.

The AR moving pictures can be seen only through the app. The staff is very nice and helps to download it and explains how to use it.

We thought it would be a quick art gallery visit, but there are a lot of paintings and halls, so it is better to allocate sufficient time for the visit.

We first saw through the app what happens on the pictures and then created our own scenes with the paintings. It was fun, and we made a lot of great videos.

The videos made through the app look cool. For the photos, I used standard camera, as photoes through the app were a bit blurred (though regular camera doesn't have 3d AR effects).

If you make photos with lion cubs, make sure to ask staff to use a standard camera on your phone and not the app. Otherwise, the photos will be blurred.

The kids were happy and we all had a lot of fun.

places.generalDescription: Jomtien Beach, also known as Chom Thian, is a serene 6-km stretch of sand lined with trees and offering various amenities such as loungers, bars, restaurants, and water sports. The beach provides uninterrupted views of Pattaya Bay and the surrounding area. Visitors can explore the hilltop viewpoint which offers panoramic views of Pattaya and Jomtien at any time of the day.

sources.snippet: Jomtien Beach, located just south of Pattaya Beach, is a slightly quieter and more laid-back option for those seeking a relaxing day by the sea. The beach stretches for six kilometres and offers a range of water sports and activities, including jet skiing, windsurfing, and parasailing. The ambience is family-friendly, making it an excellent spot for a day of sunbathing, swimming, or beach games.

Jomtien is a resort town for more relaxed travelers and offers a palm tree-lined beach that‚Äôs quiet, relaxing, and just as good as the more popular beaches.

sources.snippet: Jomtien Beach has a beautiful 6 km coastline of sand and pristine water flanked by pine groves. It is also popular for watersports like Banana Boat, Jet Ski, kite surfing, parasailing, and windsurfing.

places.name: Jomtien Beach

reviews.text: This beach is a nice spot to relax and enjoy a quiet moment by the water. The sand is clean, the sea is calm, and it's perfect for a walk or simply sitting down to admire the view. The sunsets are particularly lovely, with a soft light that's perfect for ending the day üòé‚òÄÔ∏èüôÇüôèüåá

Visited on the weekend and it wasn't crowded at all-not surprising though, as the water isn't very clean. It's okay for a stroll or to relax by the shore, but not ideal for swimming. Also, be careful if you're a tourist-many shopkeepers charge quite high prices, so it's best to compare or ask locals first. Still, it's a more peaceful alternative to Pattaya Beach.

Jomtien Beach is a nice, long beach with a huge promenade that's perfect for a walk. It has a relaxed atmosphere with plenty of sun umbrella areas and food stalls, making it a great place to spend the day. I found it to be especially enjoyable during the day.
‚ÄãJust be aware that some sections are currently under construction, so you might need to watch out for that. Also, people tend to do a lot of activities early in the morning, which adds a lively touch to the atmosphere.

places.generalDescription: Wat Phra Yai, also known as Big Buddha Hill, is a hilltop religious site located in south Pattaya. It features an 18-meter tall Buddha statue and a staircase flanked by huge dragons. The temple complex includes other popular temples like Wat Yansangwararam Woramahawihan, Wat Khao Phra Bat Temple, and Wat Pa Pradu. Visitors can enjoy the serene ambiance and panoramic views of Pattaya and its coastline from this elevated location.

sources.snippet: Wat Phra Khao Yai is also known as Big Buddha Hill, it is referred to as this because it is the biggest Buddha in the region, it stands at 18 meters tall and sits about 100 meters above sea level. When you get to the top of the hill and stand next to the Buddha you can see Pattaya beneath you and Jomtien Beach if you look outwards. As well as the Buddha there is a temple complex as well which has incense burning all day long as well many bells.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things to Do in Pattaya (Thailand)

sources.snippet: The walk to the top of the hill is lovely, but you will need a reasonable level of fitness to make it. Why it‚Äôs so awesome: You can‚Äôt go to Thailand and not experience the traditional culture and religions and this temple is a great place to start. It‚Äôs one of the most famous places in Pattaya amongst locals and tourists and still functions as a working temple.

sources.snippet: Perched atop Pratumnak Hill, Wat Phra Khao Yai, also known as Big Buddha Hill, offers a panoramic view of Pattaya and its stunning coastline. places.name: Wat Phra Yai

reviews.text:
BIG BUDDHA TEMPLE

This is a beautiful temple. There is a clear sign indicating the direction to go, a short walk up a hill and then you reach the temple. Suggest going there early in morning or an evening.
The stairs leading up provide a photo opportunity. In the temple, there are multiple forms of Buddha there, and great views from the top across the city of Pattaya. Nearby there are walking trails too.

Beautiful temple with Big Buddha. Many people visit it every day.

The statue is the largest Buddha image in the Chonburi province of Thailand (18-meter-tall golden Buddha). As well you can see some great views of Jomtien and the ocean below.

There are free toilets. Free entrance.

I saw there cats, dogs and even 2 sweet frogs.

Very accessible and easy to reach. Right beside it is another temple, so you can visit two in one trip. We went around noon and it was quite hot, but once at the top it felt refreshing with the breeze. As a bonus, there were so many dragonflies flying around, which made the atmosphere even more peaceful. A calm and serene place-definitely a must-visit.

places.generalDescription: Mini Siam is a captivating miniature park that showcases scaled-down replicas of famous landmarks and historical buildings from Thailand's rich history as well as iconic sites from around the world. Visitors can marvel at miniatures of renowned cultural sites such as Wat Arun, Ananta Samakhom Throne Hall, and Wat Phra Kaew, alongside European landmarks like the Tower Bridge and the Eiffel Tower. The park offers a unique opportunity to feel like a giant while exploring these intricate models.

places.name: Mini Siam

reviews.text:
Visiting Mini Siam was an enchanting experience that transported me around the world in just a few hours. This miniature park showcases over 100 meticulously crafted replicas of iconic landmarks from Thailand and across the globe, all at a 1:25 scale.

The park is divided into two main sections: Mini Siam, featuring Thai heritage sites like Wat Arun and the Temple of the Emerald Buddha, and Mini Europe, displaying international marvels such as the Eiffel Tower, Statue of Liberty, and Sydney Opera House. The attention to detail in each model is astounding, making it a photographer's paradise and an educational journey for visitors of all ages.

I recommend visiting during the early morning or late afternoon to avoid the midday heat and to see the models beautifully illuminated. The park is well-maintained, with friendly staff and ample facilities, including rest areas and souvenir shops.
lets-tour-bangkok.com

Whether you're a history enthusiast, architecture lover, or simply looking for a unique attraction in Pattaya, Mini Siam offers a delightful and informative experience that's not to be missed.

I came here as a kid about 20 years ago, and now I'm back again. It feels like time has frozen. Everything looks just like it did back then. It's a nice place where you can enjoy seeing lots of amazing architecture from around the world.
We came around sunset, so it wasn't too hot and it was nice to walk around. If you're free or just want a change of mood, it's worth a visit.
P.S. Don't expect too much, just come and enjoy it for what it is!

A useful tip: buy the train ride ticket along with your entrance ticket. It's cheaper that way, and the mini train ride is a must-do! It's a fun, relaxing ride around the park, and honestly, it feels like stepping back into your childhood.

Mini Siam is a fantastic place to explore miniature versions of world-famous landmarks and wonders - from the Eiffel Tower to the Statue of Liberty, all in one spot! It's a great place for both adults and kids to enjoy.

I recommend visiting in the evening, when the weather is cooler. Avoid the afternoon if possible - it gets really sunny and hot, which can make it hard to enjoy walking around.

Don't miss this charming attraction - especially the train ride!

reviews.text:
It was truly an unforgettable experience! The park is well-maintained, clean, and professionally managed. The staff were very friendly, knowledgeable, and clearly cared about the animals.

Interacting with the tigers was both exciting and surreal. The handlers made me feel completely safe while allowing me to get up close with these majestic animals. It was amazing to see how calm and well-trained the tigers were. The experience of touching and taking photos with them was once in a lifetime!

Overall, I highly recommend Pattaya Tiger Park to anyone visiting the area. It's an incredible opportunity to witness the beauty and power of tigers up close in a safe and controlled environment.

Worth the money.
Recommendation: 1. Get a ticket to spend some time with the medium sized tiger.
2. If you are using a cab, your cab driver might get you a discount on ticket.
3. Don't be scared of the tiger just follow the crew.
4. Don't touch the tiger anywhere you are not supposed to.
5. Before doing anything stupid remember tiger is 6x stronger than a human and has

Bite Force:
A tiger's bite force can reach 1,050 PSI, about six times stronger than a human's bite force of 162 PSI. This strong bite can crush bones and inflict serious damage.

Muscle Strength:
Tigers have a more muscular build than humans, with developed deltoids and pecs. They can lift and carry prey up to twice their own body weight, with some estimates suggesting they can lift up to 1,210 pounds (550 kg).

Paw Swipe Strength:
A tiger's paw swipe can exert a force of around 10,000 lbs. This strength, coupled with their sharp claws, makes them incredibly dangerous in close combat.

(source: google)

places.name: The Million Years Stone Park & Pattaya Crocodile Farm

reviews.text:
Oh, my first time to visit and I love it. I was glad we were able to come and see the park. Upon entering you will be greeted by preserved stones, woods, even stalagmites preserved through millions of years, and the setting is just awesome and mesmerizing. I just hope they would have places labels for more information. Then, the next host - a float of crocodiles. Huge, scary, and powerful creatures ( a total hair raiser), then there are giraffes, elephants, crocodile show (a mixture of comedy and fear), tigers, and other animals and birds.

A nice place to explore whether you are alone, with a partner, or with a group. Just please be careful of your things and be mindful of the rules and restrictions.

Toilets can be found near the entrance and at the middle of the park.

Ticket for foreigner is 500 baht but if you have your work permit with you (just show your work permit or a photo of your wp), you will only pay 200 baht.

I will definitely come back amd visit this place again, I just hope I won't dream of crocodiles tonight. Haha.

Heartbroken by What I Saw ‚Äì Please Don't Support This Place

I'm not an animal rights activist. I'm just a normal traveler who usually enjoys proper, well-run zoos and wildlife parks.
But visiting Million Years Stone Park in Pattaya broke my heart - and I feel responsible to warn others.
It was a mistake.

At first, the park looks impressive. But the truth behind the shows is heartbreaking:
‚Ä¢	The tigers looked exhausted, breathing heavily, some making sounds that honestly felt like crying. Others didn't even move, which is not how a healthy tiger should behave. Trainers kept forcing them to open their mouths for tourist photos, even though they clearly didn't want to. Their eyes could barely stay open. It's obvious they are heavily sedated - they don't even bother closing the cages because the tigers are too weak to move.
After my visit, I looked at photos online and realized it's always the same two tigers used for all the tourist photos. They are chained so tightly they can't even stand or lie down properly.
‚Ä¢	The crocodile show was disgusting and made me feel genuinely uneasy, with handlers taunting and dragging the crocodiles around for entertainment.
‚Ä¢	The elephants were chained tightly with barely any space to move - even after hours, there was nowhere for them to roam.
‚Ä¢	The giraffes were standing out in the blazing sun with minimal shade for the number of animals, left to suffer in the heat and likely hunger.

The enclosures only look nice on the surface.
When you really look, they are far too small, poorly built, and depressing - some cages are barely bigger than a bathroom.

This isn't conservation.
It's pure exploitation.
There's nothing educational or inspiring here - just sadness dressed up for tourists.

Don't let the cheap ticket fool you.
You're far better off spending the same money at a proper zoo or a true sanctuary where animals are respected and cared for.

In 2025, smart, compassionate travelers are choosing better.
Compassion is the new luxury - and true travel memories should leave you proud, not uneasy.

If you are human with a heart, and you believe slavery is wrong, then you should also believe no animal deserves to live this way.
Please don't support this cruelty.

I deeply regret going there.
No one should be encouraged to happily take photos with an enslaved, suffering animal.

Visited The Million Years Stone Park & Pattaya Crocodile Farm and it was a wonderful experience.

The place is very calm, beautifully scenic, and extremely well maintained. There are many animals around including tigers, crocodiles, giraffes, horses, and a variety of birds.

A great spot to spend time with family and enjoy nature along with wildlife. Highly recommend visiting! Cheers!

reviews.text:
Had a good time at Pattaya Floating Market. Nice place to walk around and see local culture. You can buy souvenirs, try different Thai foods, and pick up some gifts for family and friends.

The boat rides inside the market are fun, and you get to see shops selling things from the boats too. Some cultural shows also happen there, which was interesting to watch.

Overall, a good experience. Worth visiting if you're in Pattaya.

Pattaya Floating Market is a charming and vibrant place that offers a unique cultural experience. It's beautifully designed to reflect traditional Thai architecture, and walking through the wooden bridges and canals really gives you the feeling of being in old-world Thailand. There are plenty of shops and stalls selling local handicrafts, souvenirs, clothes, and delicious Thai street food.

The boat ride was a lovely touch ‚Äì cruising through the canals while seeing the market from the water added an extra layer of charm. There are also live performances and cultural shows throughout the day, which are fun and colorful.

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is that some parts felt a bit commercialized, with prices higher than usual local markets. It's also quite busy during peak hours, so coming early is a good idea to avoid crowds and heat.

That said, it's still a great place to spend a few hours exploring, taking photos, and enjoying authentic Thai snacks. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Pattaya and want to experience something traditional and family-friendly. A fun and scenic destination for tourists of all ages!

We visited this place as a part of our city tour package. The place is not very clean. They offered lunch in the package as well but we did not take the lunch there as the place did not look very clean. But the place is a great place to get the cultural exposure to the Thai culture and you can do some shopping here as well

places.generalDescription: Khao Chi Chan, also known as Buddha Mountain, is a famous landmark in Na Chom Thian, just 15 km from Pattaya. The highlight of this attraction is the impressive 109-meter-tall golden Buddha laser engraving on a limestone hill. This remarkable site was created to commemorate King Rama IX's 50-year reign and has become a religious and cultural symbol.

sources.snippet: Khao Chi Chan is another famous tourist attraction in Chonburi. There is a Buddha image carved on a rock cliff in the form of the largest Buddha image in the world to be the Buddha image of the reign of King Rama IX to offer as a merit on the 50th anniversary of the reign of His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej Maha Bhumibol Adulyadej is a seated Buddha image in the attitude of subduing Mara, imitating the Buddha image of the Buddha image in Sukhothai and Lanna style with the height of 109 meters.
sources.shortName: Veranda Resort Pattaya Na Jomtien

sources.snippet: Khao Chi Chan or Buddha Mountain as English speakers refer to it is the biggest engraving of Buddha in the world. The Limestone hill that has the Buddha engraved on it used to be an active site for the construction industry before it was closed down. In 1996 a laser was used to etch the carving into the rock as part of a celebration for His Majesty the King of Thailand‚Äôs 50th year on the throne.

places.name: Khao Chi Chan

reviews.text: üìå‚õ∞Ô∏èüåü  Buddha Mountain, also known as Khao Chi Chan is a hugh limestone mountain near Pattaya with a golden Buddha statue that is 70 meters board and  109 meters tall. A major spiritual and artistic monument with a peachful park surrounding it, it was created in 1996 to commemorate King Bhumibol Aduladej's Golden Jubilee utilizing laser technology and inlaid with gold leaf. A stunning location and many trees that provide shade and are good for relaxing.

Khao Chi Chan or as the people call it laser Buddha. A gaint Buddha figure carved on the side of a mountain with a laser and bordered in Golden paint.
Located slightly further away from proper Pattaya. Most car rentals refuse to go there or charge large amounts. But the best option is to rent a bike or simply use Bolt app. Our trip from soi 7 hotel to Khao chi Chan costed us 210 baht.
There are no entry tickets and ample free parking is there. Bolt is also easily available there. There is large garden and a small pond of sorts in front of the mountain. There is rest room and very few food stalls. In summer best to bring an umbrella or hat.
Visit this place on a light rainy day, everything is so pleasant. Fresh air , wide scenery with the stunning golden line of big Buddha on the rocky mountain surface.

places.generalDescription: The Cave Beach Club is a stylish and chic beach club that offers stunning ocean views and a relaxed atmosphere. The venue features Balinese-inspired indoor spaces with outdoor elements, creating a natural and inviting ambiance. Guests can enjoy a variety of Thai and Western cuisine, as well as refreshing cocktails while taking in the picturesque brown, white, and blue decor that provides plenty of Instagrammable moments.

sources.snippet: Imagine this ‚Äìfeet-in-the-sand, bean bags on the beach, and sip on some fresh coconut water and enjoy the sea breeze. It is a good chill-out beachfront cafe to unwind and relax in Pattaya. Located next to The Glasshouse, The Cave Beach Club is divided into an air-conditioned seating and alfresco seating.

reviews.text: Cave Beach Club in Pattaya is a stunning beachfront spot with a beautifully designed, boho-chic interior featuring thatched roofs, bamboo accents, and cozy bean bags, creating the perfect atmosphere to relax by the sea. The Balinese-inspired decor and outdoor seating make it incredibly Instagrammable, and the ocean views are breathtaking. The food is delicious, offering a mix of flavorful Thai dishes, Western cuisine, and refreshing cocktails. However, the service can be a bit inconsistent-you may need to call the attendants as they pass by, and orders can sometimes arrive in a random sequence. Despite this, the overall experience is fantastic, and the ambiance makes up for any service delays. If you're in Pattaya, this is definitely a must-visit beach club!

places.generalDescription: Frost Magical Ice of Siam is a unique indoor-outdoor attraction in Pattaya, featuring elaborate ice sculptures and a bar. It's the first ice dome in the area, offering visitors a chance to experience Thailand's rich culture with an international twist. The park covers over 30,000 sqm and showcases various zones displaying Thai tradition, including the Himmapan zone with mystical creatures and culture. Visitors can enjoy photography opportunities and even slide down an ice sculpture.

sources.snippet: Frost Magical Ice of Siam is the largest ice sculptures amusement park in Southeast Asia, covering the area of over 30,000 sqm. Here, you will find various ice sculptures displaying Thai tradition divided into various zones such as The Himmapan zone that talks about Himmapan mystical creatures and culture. This magnificent place surely has a lot to offer when it comes to photography.
sources.shortName: 10 Photo Spots & Places In Pattaya 2024

sources.snippet: One of the most fascinating Pattaya tourist places, the Frost Magical Ice of Siam is an exhibition featuring various ice sculptures. The ocean sculptures are built very artistically and are worth paying a visit. The surface is made of ice as well.

sources.snippet: Frost Magical of Siam is a world of ice sculptures where the temperature is -10 degrees Celsius and consists of snow, an ice cave, domes, and many slides. Outside is decorated with gigantic all-white sculptures depicting various Thai folklore.

places.name: FROST Magical Ice of Siam

reviews.text: Pleasant surprise when we found this place online. So happy we made time to visit. This was my daughter's first experience with cold and snow (they live in the Philippines) and it was a lot of fun for all of us. It's a must try. Little pricey if you add the photographing service, prints and souvenirs but well worth the visit.  The exterior has beautiful sculptures, the interior is so much fun for pics and videos and the walk next door to the ice cream shop and candy land make this a must visit place!

This is one of the coolest place to visit in Pattaya!! After an exhausting sunny day in corral island we decided to visit here next day,it was an amazing experience for us! Ticket was around 1200 per person with complimentary drink and gloves!
Staffs were friendly, you can get your photos framed in a beautiful frozen themed frame with glittery snowflakes, that was the best souvenir for me so far!!

I recently visited Frost Magic Ice of Siam with my niece and overall it was a fun and memorable experience for children. Inside, the attractions were well set up and there were several activities that kids really enjoyed, such as playing snowball fights, riding on a sleigh, and sliding down on a big tube. The environment gave them a chance to experience something different, especially since the temperature inside is extremely cold at around -15¬∞C. One of the highlights was that each guest received a complimentary drink, and after finishing it, children were allowed to throw the ice cup against the wall. This small activity was surprisingly fun and became one of the things the kids enjoyed the most.

While the activities and atmosphere inside were enjoyable, one area that could be improved is the seating for guardians waiting outside. Many parents or relatives do not go inside because of the freezing temperature, and instead remain outside. Unfortunately, the waiting area outside was very hot and uncomfortable. It would be a great improvement if Frost Magic Ice of Siam could make the caf√© near the ticket counter into an air-conditioned waiting zone. This would make the experience much more pleasant for everyone, especially guardians who cannot tolerate extreme cold.

places.generalDescription: Anek Kusala Sala, also known as Viharn Sien, is a stunning lakeside temple that serves as both an art gallery and a museum. Originally built to commemorate the King's birthday and foster Chinese-Thai relations, it now showcases a fusion of both cultures. The museum features over 300 artworks including statues of historical figures and religious deities, as well as brass and bronze sculptures depicting common people from ancient times.

sources.snippet: Why it‚Äôs so awesome: This museum contains more than 300 pieces of Chinese artwork, mostly consisting of brass and bronze statues of historical figures and deities. If you don‚Äôt know much about Chinese history, which is fairly normal for people from western countries, this museum will give you the chance to learn. What to do there: There are two floors of statues, with the largest ones on the top floor.
sources.shortName: 31 BEST Places to Visit in Pattaya (2025 Guide)

sources.snippet: Viharn Sien - Anek kusala Sala is a beautiful Chinese temple that also houses a museum of Chinese artefacts and antiques. It is also known as Viharnra sien, which translates as "House of Gods." It is situated next to a lovely lake. Before entering the building, you can see some Chinese mythological figures, but the main attraction is inside.

reviews.text: Very impressive collection. I spent over an hour there. The entry fee is 50 baht, very reasonable. It was not crowded, even though this is the high tourist season. You'll need a car to get there; I was driven by friends. There's no toilet in the museum; use the one across the road before you go in. I'd definitely go again.

This place is truly underrated. It's essentially a museum featuring many historical sculptures and statues from mainland China. The most fascinating part is the collection of Terracotta Army figures from Xi'an. Situated by a peaceful reservoir, the area also offers the chance to feed plenty of fish. On the opposite side, there's a large Thai temple worth exploring.
Beautiful museum!  Remember to take your shoes off before entering.  It can be slippery if you are wearing socks. Many levels.   Beautiful views all around.

places.generalDescription: Pattaya Elephant Village is a cultural sanctuary that offers various activities such as elephant and ox-cart rides, traditional Thai dance shows, and silk-weaving demonstrations. It serves as a haven for rescued and retired elephants, promoting conservation and responsible tourism. Visitors can engage in ethical interactions with the elephants, including feeding, bathing, and leisurely rides through the scenic surroundings. The village provides an educational experience while emphasizing the well-being of these magnificent creatures.

This attraction features a 100-meter-long tunnel that provides a unique opportunity to observe diverse marine species, including sharks, rays, and colourful coral reefs, without getting wet. The interactive touch pool allows visitors to interact with some of the smaller sea creatures, making it an educational and entertaining experience, especially for families with children.

Underwater Pattaya is an absolutely amazing experience! üåäüê† The atmosphere inside is mesmerizing, and the way everything is presented makes you feel like you are walking through the ocean itself. The variety of marine life is fascinating, from colorful fishes to unique sea creatures, all beautifully displayed. The maintenance is top-notch-clean, well-organized, and perfectly managed, which adds to the comfort of the visit. It's also very family-friendly and great for kids as they learn and enjoy at the same time. The glass tunnel and large aquariums are breathtaking highlights. Truly, it's a must-visit attraction in Pattaya that gives you unforgettable memories and a deeper appreciation for the underwater world. üåü
